definitions.definition: publicly display (a work of art or item of interest) in an art gallery or museum or at a trade fair.
examples: only one sculpture was exhibited in the artist's lifetime

definitions.definition: (of an artist) display one's work to the public in an art gallery or museum.
examples: she was invited to exhibit at several French museums
synonyms: arrange "the paintings were exhibited at the Wadsworth"

definitions.definition: publicly display the work of (an artist) in an art gallery or museum.
manifest or deliberately display (a quality or a type of behavior).
examples: he could exhibit a saintlike submissiveness
synonyms: present; formalevince "Luke exhibited signs of jealousy"

definitions.definition: show as a sign or symptom.
examples: patients with alcoholic liver disease exhibit many biochemical abnormalities
